intro: Hieracium schmidtii subsp. giresunense, commonly known as the Giresun hawkweed, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its flowering heads and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountainous conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
